availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Legal] 1799 April, Tennessee [to] Sheriff of Knox County / Charles McClung
bibl.author: McClung, Charles
bibl.note: This is a letter from Charles McClung to the sheriff of Knox County, Tennessee dated April 1799. The sheriff is ordered to obtain a sum of money from Robert Reynolds that is owed to McClung.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

address.addrLine: To the Sheriff of Knox County,

div.p: You are hereby commanded, that of the goods and chattels, lands and tenements of Robert Reynolds of your county, you cause to be made the sum of Seventy Seven Dollar four & 1/3 cents which lately in our county court of Pleas and Charles McClung Quarter-sessions, held for the county of Knox, Charles MClung recovered against him for Breach of promise and also the further sum of Eleven Dollars fifteen & 1/2 cents for costs and charges in the said suit expended, whereof the said Robert Reynolds is convict and liable, as appears to us of records and have you those monies before our said court to be held for the county of Knox, at Knoxville, on the Second Monday in July next, so as to render the said debe , damages, and costs aforesaid; and have you then there this Writ, and how you have executed the same Witness, Charles MClung, Clerk of our said court, at office, the Second Monday in April 1799 and in the XX m year of our Independence,
